fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of the journal.

Biblatex: journaltitle

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description:
The subtitle of a journal.

Biblatex: journalsubtitle

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the name of the journal.
This may be useful in case a journal has been renamed or if the journal name isn't unique.

Biblatex: journaltitleaddon

fields.name: issn
fields.description:
The International Standard Serial Number of a journal.

Biblatex: issn

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: JournalIssue
types.description: An issue of a journal.

fields.name: journal
fields.description: The journal in which the article has been published.

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The title of a specific issue of a journal.

Biblatex: issuetitle

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description:
The subtitle of a specific issue of a journal.

Biblatex: issuesubtitle

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the title of the specific issue of a journal.
This may be useful when a special issue of a journal has a title that doesn't make it clear that it is a special issue and one wants to emphasize that.

Biblatex: issuetitleaddon

fields.name: number
fields.description:
The number of the issue.

Normally this field will be an integer or an integer range, but it may also be a short designator that is not entirely numeric such as “S1”, “Suppl. 2”, “3es”.
Usually, the number is displayed close to the volume, e.g. 10.2 (volume: 10, number: 2).

Biblatex: number

fields.name: name
fields.description:
This field is intended for journals whose individual issues are identified by a designation such as Lent, Michaelmas, Summer or Spring rather than the month or a number.
Usually the issue name is displayed in front of the year and not the volume.

Biblatex: issue

fields.name: series
fields.description:
The name or number of a journal series.
Usually, after the journal has restarted publication with a new numbering.

Biblatex: series

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
The volume of the journal this issue is part of.

Biblatex: volume

types.name: JournalArticle
types.description:
An article published in a journal disseminates the results of original research and scholarship.
It is usually peer-reviewed and published under a separate title in a journal issue or periodical containing other works of the same form.

Biblatex: article
CSL: article-journal or article
ORCID: journal-article
CERIF: JournalArticle

TODO:
- Decide if "editor" should be added (it is supported by biblatex). What's the purpose, and does it refer to an editor of the article or an editor of the journal?
- Decide if "version" should be added (it is supported by biblatex, but the definition says "The revision number of a piece of software, a manual, etc." which is not very specific).

fields.name: in
fields.description: The issue of the journal in which the article has been published.

fields.name: published
fields.description:
The publication date.

Biblatex: date (or month + year)

fields.name: annotators
fields.description:
The authors of annotations to the article.

Biblatex: annotator

fields.name: commentators
fields.description:
The authors of a commentary to the work.
Note that this field is intended for commented editions which have a commentator in addition to the author. If the work is a stand-alone commentary, the commentator should be given in the author.

Biblatex: commentator

types.name: ProceedingsArticle
types.description:
An article that has been presented at a conference and published in a proceedings (not in scholarly journals).

Biblatex: inproceedings (or conference)
CSL: paper-conference
ORCID: conference-paper
CERIF: Conference Proceedings Article

fields.name: in
fields.description: The proceedings in which the article has been published.

types.name: Proceedings
types.description:
A collection of articles, published abstracts or posters gathered from a conference.
This may be a single volume in a multi-volume proceedings or a publication consisting only of a single volume.

Biblatex: proceedings
CSL: book
ORCID: book
CERIF: Conference Proceedings

TODO:
  - Decide what to do with biblatex fields "chapter, eid, pages" that are used to limit the citation to a specific part of the proceedings (right?). They are not really metadata of the proceedings, but only of the citation.
  - Add editors with their roles.

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The title of the document.

Biblatex: title (or booktitle in a ProceedingsArticle)

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description:
The subtitle of the document.

Biblatex: subtitle (or booksubtitle in a ProceedingsArticle)

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the title of the document.

Biblatex: titleaddon (or booktitleaddon in a ProceedingsArticle)

fields.name: in
fields.description: The multi-volume proceedings of which this proceedings is part of.

fields.name: conference
fields.description: The conference of the proceedings.

types.name: ProceedingsMultiVolume
types.description:
A multi-volume conference proceedings.

Biblatex: mvproceedings
CSL: book
ORCID: book
CERIF: Conference Proceedings

TODO:
  - Decide what to do with biblatex fields "chapter, eid, pages" that are used to limit the citation to a specific part of the proceedings (right?). They are not really metadata of the proceedings, but only of the citation.
  - Add editors with their roles.

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The title of the document.

Biblatex: title (or maintitle in a ProceedingsArticle or Proceedings)

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description:
The subtitle of the document.

Biblatex: subtitle (or mainsubtitle in a ProceedingsArticle or Proceedings)

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the title of the document.

Biblatex: titleaddon (or maintitleaddon in a ProceedingsArticle or Proceedings)

fields.name: conference
fields.description: The conference of the proceedings.

types.name: Thesis
types.description:
A dissertation/thesis is written for an educational institution that leads to the acquirement of a degree.

Biblatex: thesis (or phdthesis or mastersthesis)
CSL: thesis
ORCID: dissertation or dissertation-thesis
CERIF: PhD Thesis or Doctoral Thesis

TODO: Decide what to do with biblatex fields "chapter, eid, pages" that are used to limit the reference to a specific part of the thesis. They are not really metadata of the thesis, but only of the citation.

fields.name: degreeType
fields.description:
The type of the degree obtained by the author.

Biblatex: type

fields.name: institution
fields.description: The university or some other institution where the thesis has been written at.

fields.name: pageTotal
fields.description:
The total number of pages of the thesis.

Biblatex: pagetotal

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: DocumentFilters
types.description: Ways in which to filter a list of documents.

inputFields.name: groupId
inputFields.description: Only include documents that belong to the group with this ID.

inputFields.name: query
inputFields.description: Only include documents that match the given search string.

fields.name: documents
fields.description: A list of documents that belong to the user.

args.name: first
args.description: Number of documents to be returned

args.name: after
args.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: UserDocumentsConnection
types.description: A connection model between user and documents.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

types.name: UserDocumentsEdge
types.description: An edge connecting the user to a document node

fields.name: node
fields.description: A node containing a document

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about the next page and end cursor for pagination.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Translatable
types.description: A document that can be translated.

fields.name: translated
fields.description: Contains information if the document has been translated.

types.name: Translated
types.description: Information about a translation of a document.

fields.name: translators
fields.description:
The translators of the document.

Biblatex: translator

fields.name: originalLanguages
fields.description:
The languages of the original document.
TODO: Introduce type for languages.

Biblatex: origlanguage

types.name: Institution
types.description: A university or some other institution.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the institution.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of the university or institution.

Biblatex: institution

fields.name: locations
fields.description:
The locations of the institution.

Biblatex: location (or address)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the publisher.

fields.name: locations
fields.description:
The locations of the publisher.

Biblatex: location

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of the publisher.

Biblatex: publisher, or organization for Other

types.name: Event
types.description: A conference, a symposium, or some other event.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the event.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description:
The date when the event started.

Biblatex: eventday,eventhour, eventminute, eventmonth, eventsecond, eventtimezone, eventyear, eventyeardivision

fields.name: endDate
fields.description:
The date when the event ended.

Biblatex: eventendday, eventendhour, eventendminute, eventendmonth, eventendsecond, eventendtimezone, eventendyear, eventendyeardivision

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The title of the event.

Biblatex: eventtitle

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the title. Can be used for known event acronyms, for example.

Biblatex: eventtitleaddon

fields.name: sponsors
fields.description:
The organizations that sponsored the event.

Biblatex: organization

fields.name: locations
fields.description:
The locations where the event happened.

Biblatex: venue

types.name: Document
types.description:
The different types of documents are mostly compatible with the types listed in the following sources. If known, the mapping is indicated in the comment of each type.
  - Biblatex http://mirrors.ibiblio.org/CTAN/macros/latex/contrib/biblatex/doc/biblatex.pdf
  - CSL https://github.com/citation-style-language/schema/blob/master/schemas/styles/csl-types.rnc (and outdated https://docs.citationstyles.org/en/stable/specification.html?highlight=entry-dictionary#appendix-iii-types)
  - ORCID https://info.orcid.org/documentation/integration-and-api-faq/#easy-faq-2682
  - CERIF https://cerif.eurocris.org/vocab/html/OutputTypes.html

The fields for each type are mostly compatible with the fields in the following sources. If known, the mapping is indicated in the comment of each field.
  - Biblatex: https://github.com/plk/biblatex/blob/dev/tex/latex/biblatex/blx-dm.def
  - CSL: https://github.com/citation-style-language/schema/blob/master/schemas/input/csl-data.json
  - ORCID: https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model

The mapping was based on the following sources:
  - https://github.com/retorquere/zotero-better-bibtex/blob/master/translators/Better%20BibLaTeX.ts
  - https://github.com/fiduswriter/biblatex-csl-converter/blob/main/src/const.ts

fields.name: citationKeys
fields.description:
The keys by which the document can be cited.
The first key is the preferred one, the others are aliases to aid users who change their citation keys but have legacy documents which use older keys for the same entry.

Biblatex: citekey (primary) and ids (secondary)

fields.name: lastModified
fields.description:
The date when the metadata of the document was modified last.

Biblatex: no standard field

fields.name: added
fields.description:
The date when the document was added to the library.

Biblatex: no standard field

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The title of the document.

Biblatex: title

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description:
The subtitle of the document.

Biblatex: subtitle

fields.name: titleAddon
fields.description:
An annex to the title of the document.

Biblatex: titleaddon

fields.name: abstract
fields.description:
A short description that summarizes the document.

Biblatex: abstract

fields.name: authors
fields.description:
The authors of this document.

Biblatex: author

fields.name: note
fields.description:
Miscellaneous bibliographic data which does not fit into any other field.
Publication facts such as “Reprint of the edition London 1831” are typical candidates.

Biblatex: note

fields.name: languages
fields.description:
The languages of the article.
TODO: Introduce type for languages.

Biblatex: language

fields.name: publicationState
fields.description:
The publication state of the article.
TODO: Introduce type for publication states.

Biblatex: pubstate

fields.name: doi
fields.description:
The Digital Object Identifier of the document.

Biblatex: doi

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Keywords or tags used to describe the content.

fields.name: isbn
fields.description:
The International Standard Book Number of the document.

Biblatex: isbn

fields.name: publishers
fields.description: The publisher of the document.

fields.name: pageTotal
fields.description:
The total number of pages of the document.

Biblatex: pagetotal

fields.name: number
fields.description:
The number of the document in a series.
Document in a publication series are usually numbered and the number or volume of a document in a series is given in this field.

Biblatex: number

fields.name: series
fields.description:
The name of a publication series, such as “Studies in ...”.

Biblatex: series

fields.name: in
fields.description: The parent document in which the document has been published.

fields.name: pageStart
fields.description:
The page on which the article starts; for example '135' or 'xiii'.
For articles in electronic journals with a non-classical pagination setup the electricId may be more suitable.

Biblatex: page

fields.name: pageEnd
fields.description:
The page on which the article ends; for example '138' or 'xvi'.

Biblatex: page

fields.name: electronicId
fields.description:
The electronic identifier which should be used for journals deviating from the classic pagination scheme of printed journals by only enumerating articles and not pages.

Biblatex: eid

fields.name: chapter
fields.description: A chapter or section or any other unit in the parent document.

fields.name: in
fields.description: The multi-volume document of which this document is part of.

fields.name: part
fields.description:
The number of a partial volume.
It may be used when a logical volume consists of two or more physical ones.
In this case the number of the logical volume goes in the volume field and the number of the part of that volume in the part field.

Biblatex: part

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
The volume of a multi-volume proceedings.

Biblatex: volume

types.name: Article
types.description: An article is a usually self-contained nonfiction prose.

fields.name: totalVolumes
fields.description:
The total number of volumes of a multi-volume document.

Biblatex: volumes

types.name: Other
types.description:
A fallback type for works which do not fit into any other category.

Biblatex: value of "type" field, or "misc" if not present
CSL: article
ORCID: other
CERIF: Other

TODO:
- Add editor with roles.

fields.name: howPublished
fields.description:
A publication notice.

Biblatex: howpublished

fields.name: publishers
fields.description: The publishers of this document.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of this document.

Biblatex: entry type

types.name: AddUserDocumentInput
types.description: Input for creating a new user document.

fields.name: group
fields.description: Get the group by id.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Get user by id.

fields.name: me
fields.description: Get the current user.

types.name: AutomaticKeywordGroup
types.description: A group that automatically generates subgroups based on keywords contained in documents.

enumValues.name: INDEPENDENT
enumValues.description: The group's content is independent of its hierarchical position.

enumValues.name: INTERSECTION
enumValues.description: The group's content is the intersection of its own content with its supergroups' content.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: The group's content is the union of its own content with its subgroups' content.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an identifier that is unique across all objects in the graph.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the node.

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard internet email address format as specified in RFC822: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc822/.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
